intro: Coussarea revoluta, commonly known as the red-berried holly, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its berries, which turn bright red when mature, are a key feature and attract various bird species. Coussarea revoluta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
